rules: Rule1: In cases where the bartender is licensed, the bar will be orderly.
Rule2: Whenever the bouncer is checking an identification document, the patron will be intoxicated or it is not the case that the patron is sober.
Rule3: Either the bouncer is checking an identification document or the bouncer is scanning an identification document.
Rule4: Provided that the bouncer is scanning an identification document, the patron is intoxicated or it is not the case that the patron is sober.
Rule5: Under the condition that the patron is being cut off from service, the bartender will have been serving a drink to the patron.
Rule6: Either the patron is being cut off from service, or if the bartender mixing a drink does not imply that the drink is not alcoholic, then the bouncer will not perform proper verification.
Rule7: Either the bouncer is warning the patron or the bouncer is escorting the patron out.
Rule8: Should the bouncer be escorting the patron out, the bartender will not be serving a drink to the patron.
Rule9: Given that the patron is committing a first offense, if the bouncer is warning the patron, then the bartender will not be serving a drink to the patron.
Rule10: The patron either commits a first offense or commits a repeat offense.
Rule11: In cases where the patron possesses an identification document, the bartender will be licensed.

Rule12: Either the patron commits a minor violation, or if the patron is committing a repeat offense, then if the bouncer is warning the patron, the bartender will not be serving a drink to the patron.
Rule13: The patron either has a valid identification document or has an invalid identification document.
Rule14: In situations where the patron has an invalid identification document, the patron will possess a counterfeit identification document.
Rule15: Whenever there is conflicting evidence regarding the patron, the patron will be approved for entry.
Rule16: Provided that there is conflicting evidence regarding the patron, the patron will not be approved for entry.
Rule17: Should the manager make a decision, the patron will not be allowed entry.
Rule18: Either the manager makes a decision, or if the bartender is not licensed, then the staff member will not be unlicensed.
Rule19: In instances where the patron possesses a counterfeit identification document, the bartender will be licensed.
Rule20: Provided that the patron is denied entry, the patron will be allowed entry.
Rule21: Whenever the manager violates policy, if the manager making a decision does not imply that the patron is denied entry, then the patron will be pending review.
Rule22: Under the condition that the bartender uses a shaker tool, the bartender will be mixing a drink.
Rule23: Either the bartender uses a shaker tool, or the patron is not under the legal drinking age.
Rule24: In cases where the bartender is mixing a drink, the drink will be alcoholic.
Rule25: Provided that the bartender is mixing a drink, the drink will be non-alcoholic.
Rule26: In situations where the drink is non-alcoholic, the drink will not be alcoholic.
Rule27: Under the condition that the patron is playing the game of darts, the patron will be sober.
Rule28: Either the patron is playing the game of darts, or the patron either possesses an identification document or possesses a counterfeit identification document.

Rule29: In circumstances where it is not the case that the patron either possesses an identification document or possesses a counterfeit identification document, the patron will be under the legal drinking age.
Rule30: In cases where it is not the case that if the bartender is mixing a drink then the drink is not alcoholic, the bouncer will perform proper verification.

Rule31: In instances where it is not the case that if it is not the case that if it is not the case that if the patron has a valid identification document then the patron possesses an identification document, then the patron has a questionable identification document, then the patron has an unclear identification document, there will be conflicting evidence regarding the patron.
Rule32: Provided that the bartender is not licensed, the staff member will be unlicensed.
facts: Fact2: The patron is not intoxicated.
Fact3: The patron does not commit a minor violation.
Fact4: The patron does not have a questionable identification document.
Fact5: It is not the case that the patron has an unclear identification document.
Fact6: The patron is not pending review.
